  2777. #endif

  2779.     n = recv(c->fd, buf, 1, MSG_PEEK);

  2781.     if (n == 0) {
  2782.         rev->eof = 1;
  2783.         c->error = 1;
  2784.         err = 0;

  2786.         goto closed;

  2788.     } else if (n == -1) {
  2789.         err = ngx_socket_errno;

  2791.         if (err != NGX_EAGAIN) {
  2792.             rev->eof = 1;
  2793.             c->error = 1;

  2795.             goto closed;
  2796.         }
  2797.     }

  2799.     /* aio does not call this handler */

  2801.     if ((ngx_event_flags & NGX_USE_LEVEL_EVENT) && rev->active) {

  2803.         if (ngx_del_event(rev, NGX_READ_EVENT, 0) != NGX_OK) {
  2804.             ngx_http_close_request(r, 0);
  2805.         }
  2806.     }

  2808.     return;

  2810. closed:

  2812.     if (err) {
  2813.         rev->error = 1;
  2814.     }

  2816.     ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_INFO, c->log, err,
  2817.                   "client prematurely closed connection");

  2819.     ngx_http_finalize_request(r, NGX_HTTP_CLIENT_CLOSED_REQUEST);
  2820. }


  2823. static void
  2824. ‌ngx_http_set_keepalive(ngx_http_request_t *r)
  2825. {
  2826.     int                        tcp_nodelay;
  2827.     ngx_int_t                  i;
  2828.     ngx_buf_t                 *b, *f;
  2829.     ngx_event_t               *rev, *wev;
  2830.     ngx_connection_t          *c;
  2831.     ngx_http_connection_t     *hc;
  2832.     ngx_http_core_srv_conf_t  *cscf;
  2833.     ngx_http_core_loc_conf_t  *clcf;

  2835.     c = r->connection;
  2836.     rev = c->read;

  2838.     clcf = ngx_http_get_module_loc_conf(r, ngx_http_core_module);

  2840.     ngx_log_debug0(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0, "set http keepalive handler");

  2842.     if (r->discard_body) {
  2843.         r->write_event_handler = ngx_http_request_empty_handler;
  2844.         r->lingering_time = ngx_time() + (time_t) (clcf->lingering_time / 1000);
  2845.         ngx_add_timer(rev, clcf->lingering_timeout);
  2846.         return;
  2847.     }

  2849.     c->log->action = "closing request";

  2851.     hc = r->http_connection;
  2852.     b = r->header_in;

  2854.     if (b->pos < b->last) {

  2856.         /* the pipelined request */

  2858.         if (b != c->buffer) {

  2860.             /*
  2861.              * If the large header buffers were allocated while the previous
  2862.              * request processing then we do not use c->buffer for
  2863.              * the pipelined request (see ngx_http_create_request()).
  2864.              *
  2865.              * Now we would move the large header buffers to the free list.
  2866.              */

  2868.             cscf = ngx_http_get_module_srv_conf(r, ngx_http_core_module);

  2870.             if (hc->free == NULL) {
  2871.                 hc->free = ngx_palloc(c->pool,
  2872.                   cscf->large_client_header_buffers.num * sizeof(ngx_buf_t *));

  2874.                 if (hc->free == NULL) {
  2875.                     ngx_http_close_request(r, 0);
  2876.                     return;
  2877.                 }
  2878.             }

  2880.             for (i = 0; i < hc->nbusy - 1; i++) {
  2881.                 f = hc->busy[i];
  2882.                 hc->free[hc->nfree++] = f;
  2883.                 f->pos = f->start;
  2884.                 f->last = f->start;
  2885.             }

  2887.             hc->busy[0] = b;
  2888.             hc->nbusy = 1;
  2889.         }
  2890.     }

  2892.     /* guard against recursive call from ngx_http_finalize_connection() */
  2893.     r->keepalive = 0;

  2895.     ngx_http_free_request(r, 0);

  2897.     c->data = hc;

  2899.     if (ngx_handle_read_event(rev, 0) != NGX_OK) {
  2900.         ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  2901.         return;
  2902.     }

  2904.     wev = c->write;
  2905.     wev->handler = ngx_http_empty_handler;

  2907.     if (b->pos < b->last) {

  2909.         ngx_log_debug0(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0, "pipelined request");

  2911.         c->log->action = "reading client pipelined request line";

  2913.         r = ngx_http_create_request(c);
  2914.         if (r == NULL) {
  2915.             ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  2916.             return;
  2917.         }

  2919.         r->pipeline = 1;

  2921.         c->data = r;

  2923.         c->sent = 0;
  2924.         c->destroyed = 0;

  2926.         if (rev->timer_set) {
  2927.             ngx_del_timer(rev);
  2928.         }

  2930.         rev->handler = ngx_http_process_request_line;
  2931.         ngx_post_event(rev, &ngx_posted_events);
  2932.         return;
  2933.     }

  2935.     /*
  2936.      * To keep a memory footprint as small as possible for an idle keepalive
  2937.      * connection we try to free c->buffer's memory if it was allocated outside
  2938.      * the c->pool.  The large header buffers are always allocated outside the
  2939.      * c->pool and are freed too.
  2940.      */

  2942.     b = c->buffer;

  2944.     if (ngx_pfree(c->pool, b->start) == NGX_OK) {

  2946.         /*
  2947.          * the special note for ngx_http_keepalive_handler() that
  2948.          * c->buffer's memory was freed
  2949.          */

  2951.         b->pos = NULL;

  2953.     } else {
  2954.         b->pos = b->start;
  2955.         b->last = b->start;
  2956.     }

  2958.     ngx_log_debug2(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0, "hc free: %p %d",
  2959.                    hc->free, hc->nfree);

  2961.     if (hc->free) {
  2962.         for (i = 0; i < hc->nfree; i++) {
  2963.             ngx_pfree(c->pool, hc->free[i]->start);
  2964.             hc->free[i] = NULL;
  2965.         }

  2967.         hc->nfree = 0;
  2968.     }

  2970.     ngx_log_debug2(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0, "hc busy: %p %d",
  2971.                    hc->busy, hc->nbusy);

  2973.     if (hc->busy) {
  2974.         for (i = 0; i < hc->nbusy; i++) {
  2975.             ngx_pfree(c->pool, hc->busy[i]->start);
  2976.             hc->busy[i] = NULL;
  2977.         }

  2979.         hc->nbusy = 0;
  2980.     }

  2982. #if (NGX_HTTP_SSL)
  2983.     if (c->ssl) {
  2984.         ngx_ssl_free_buffer(c);
  2985.     }
  2986. #endif

  2988.     rev->handler = ngx_http_keepalive_handler;

  2990.     if (wev->active && (ngx_event_flags & NGX_USE_LEVEL_EVENT)) {
  2991.         if (ngx_del_event(wev, NGX_WRITE_EVENT, 0) != NGX_OK) {
  2992.             ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  2993.             return;
  2994.         }
  2995.     }

  2997.     c->log->action = "keepalive";

  2999.     if (c->tcp_nopush == NGX_TCP_NOPUSH_SET) {
  3000.         if (ngx_tcp_push(c->fd) == -1) {
  3001.             ngx_connection_error(c, ngx_socket_errno, ngx_tcp_push_n " failed");
  3002.             ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3003.             return;
  3004.         }

  3006.         c->tcp_nopush = NGX_TCP_NOPUSH_UNSET;
  3007.         tcp_nodelay = ngx_tcp_nodelay_and_tcp_nopush ? 1 : 0;

  3009.     } else {
  3010.         tcp_nodelay = 1;
  3011.     }

  3013.     if (tcp_nodelay
  3014.         && clcf->tcp_nodelay
  3015.         && c->tcp_nodelay == NGX_TCP_NODELAY_UNSET)
  3016.     {
  3017.         ngx_log_debug0(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0, "tcp_nodelay");

  3019.         if (setsockopt(c->fd, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY,
  3020.                        (const void *) &tcp_nodelay, sizeof(int))
  3021.             == -1)
  3022.         {
  3023. #if (NGX_SOLARIS)
  3024.             /* Solaris returns EINVAL if a socket has been shut down */
  3025.             c->log_error = NGX_ERROR_IGNORE_EINVAL;
  3026. #endif

  3028.             ngx_connection_error(c, ngx_socket_errno,
  3029.                                  "setsockopt(TCP_NODELAY) failed");

  3031.             c->log_error = NGX_ERROR_INFO;
  3032.             ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3033.             return;
  3034.         }

  3036.         c->tcp_nodelay = NGX_TCP_NODELAY_SET;
  3037.     }

  3039. #if 0
  3040.     /* if ngx_http_request_t was freed then we need some other place */
  3041.     r->http_state = NGX_HTTP_KEEPALIVE_STATE;
  3042. #endif

  3044.     c->idle = 1;
  3045.     ngx_reusable_connection(c, 1);

  3047.     ngx_add_timer(rev, clcf->keepalive_timeout);

  3049.     if (rev->ready) {
  3050.         ngx_post_event(rev, &ngx_posted_events);
  3051.     }
  3052. }


  3055. static void
  3056. ‌ngx_http_keepalive_handler(ngx_event_t *rev)
  3057. {
  3058.     size_t             size;
  3059.     ssize_t            n;
  3060.     ngx_buf_t         *b;
  3061.     ngx_connection_t  *c;

  3063.     c = rev->data;

  3065.     ngx_log_debug0(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0, "http keepalive handler");

  3067.     if (rev->timedout || c->close) {
  3068.         ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3069.         return;
  3070.     }

  3072. #if (NGX_HAVE_KQUEUE)

  3074.     if (ngx_event_flags & NGX_USE_KQUEUE_EVENT) {
  3075.         if (rev->pending_eof) {
  3076.             c->log->handler = NULL;
  3077.             ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_INFO, c->log, rev->kq_errno,
  3078.                           "kevent() reported that client %V closed "
  3079.                           "keepalive connection", &c->addr_text);
  3080. #if (NGX_HTTP_SSL)
  3081.             if (c->ssl) {
  3082.                 c->ssl->no_send_shutdown = 1;
  3083.             }
  3084. #endif
  3085.             ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3086.             return;
  3087.         }
  3088.     }

  3090. #endif

  3092.     b = c->buffer;
  3093.     size = b->end - b->start;

  3095.     if (b->pos == NULL) {

  3097.         /*
  3098.          * The c->buffer's memory was freed by ngx_http_set_keepalive().
  3099.          * However, the c->buffer->start and c->buffer->end were not changed
  3100.          * to keep the buffer size.
  3101.          */

  3103.         b->pos = ngx_palloc(c->pool, size);
  3104.         if (b->pos == NULL) {
  3105.             ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3106.             return;
  3107.         }

  3109.         b->start = b->pos;
  3110.         b->last = b->pos;
  3111.         b->end = b->pos + size;
  3112.     }

  3114.     /*
  3115.      * MSIE closes a keepalive connection with RST flag
  3116.      * so we ignore ECONNRESET here.
  3117.      */

  3119.     c->log_error = NGX_ERROR_IGNORE_ECONNRESET;
  3120.     ngx_set_socket_errno(0);

  3122.     n = c->recv(c, b->last, size);
  3123.     c->log_error = NGX_ERROR_INFO;

  3125.     if (n == NGX_AGAIN) {
  3126.         if (ngx_handle_read_event(rev, 0) != NGX_OK) {
  3127.             ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3128.             return;
  3129.         }

  3131.         /*
  3132.          * Like ngx_http_set_keepalive() we are trying to not hold
  3133.          * c->buffer's memory for a keepalive connection.
  3134.          */

  3136.         if (ngx_pfree(c->pool, b->start) == NGX_OK) {

  3138.             /*
  3139.              * the special note that c->buffer's memory was freed
  3140.              */

  3142.             b->pos = NULL;
  3143.         }

  3145.         return;
  3146.     }

  3148.     if (n == NGX_ERROR) {
  3149.         ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3150.         return;
  3151.     }

  3153.     c->log->handler = NULL;

  3155.     if (n == 0) {
  3156.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_INFO, c->log, ngx_socket_errno,
  3157.                       "client %V closed keepalive connection", &c->addr_text);
  3158.         ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3159.         return;
  3160.     }

  3162.     b->last += n;

  3164.     c->log->handler = ngx_http_log_error;
  3165.     c->log->action = "reading client request line";

  3167.     c->idle = 0;
  3168.     ngx_reusable_connection(c, 0);

  3170.     c->data = ngx_http_create_request(c);
  3171.     if (c->data == NULL) {
  3172.         ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3173.         return;
  3174.     }

  3176.     c->sent = 0;
  3177.     c->destroyed = 0;

  3179.     ngx_del_timer(rev);

  3181.     rev->handler = ngx_http_process_request_line;
  3182.     ngx_http_process_request_line(rev);
  3183. }


  3186. static void
  3187. ‌ngx_http_set_lingering_close(ngx_http_request_t *r)
  3188. {
  3189.     ngx_event_t               *rev, *wev;
  3190.     ngx_connection_t          *c;
  3191.     ngx_http_core_loc_conf_t  *clcf;

  3193.     c = r->connection;

  3195.     clcf = ngx_http_get_module_loc_conf(r, ngx_http_core_module);

  3197.     rev = c->read;
  3198.     rev->handler = ngx_http_lingering_close_handler;

  3200.     r->lingering_time = ngx_time() + (time_t) (clcf->lingering_time / 1000);
  3201.     ngx_add_timer(rev, clcf->lingering_timeout);

  3203.     if (ngx_handle_read_event(rev, 0) != NGX_OK) {
  3204.         ngx_http_close_request(r, 0);
  3205.         return;
  3206.     }

  3208.     wev = c->write;
  3209.     wev->handler = ngx_http_empty_handler;

  3211.     if (wev->active && (ngx_event_flags & NGX_USE_LEVEL_EVENT)) {
  3212.         if (ngx_del_event(wev, NGX_WRITE_EVENT, 0) != NGX_OK) {
  3213.             ngx_http_close_request(r, 0);
  3214.             return;
  3215.         }
  3216.     }

  3218.     if (ngx_shutdown_socket(c->fd, NGX_WRITE_SHUTDOWN) == -1) {
  3219.         ngx_connection_error(c, ngx_socket_errno,
  3220.                              ngx_shutdown_socket_n " failed");
  3221.         ngx_http_close_request(r, 0);
  3222.         return;
  3223.     }

  3225.     if (rev->ready) {
  3226.         ngx_http_lingering_close_handler(rev);
  3227.     }
  3228. }


  3231. static void
  3232. ‌ngx_http_lingering_close_handler(ngx_event_t *rev)
  3233. {
  3234.     ssize_t                    n;
  3235.     ngx_msec_t                 timer;
  3236.     ngx_connection_t          *c;
  3237.     ngx_http_request_t        *r;
  3238.     ngx_http_core_loc_conf_t  *clcf;
  3239.     u_char                     buffer[NGX_HTTP_LINGERING_BUFFER_SIZE];

  3241.     c = rev->data;
  3242.     r = c->data;

  3244.     ngx_log_debug0(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0,
  3245.                    "http lingering close handler");

  3247.     if (rev->timedout) {
  3248.         ngx_http_close_request(r, 0);
  3249.         return;
  3250.     }

  3252.     timer = (ngx_msec_t) r->lingering_time - (ngx_msec_t) ngx_time();
  3253.     if ((ngx_msec_int_t) timer <= 0) {
  3254.         ngx_http_close_request(r, 0);
  3255.         return;
  3256.     }

  3258.     do {
  3259.         n = c->recv(c, buffer, NGX_HTTP_LINGERING_BUFFER_SIZE);

  3261.         ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0, "lingering read: %d", n);

  3263.         if (n == NGX_ERROR || n == 0) {
  3264.             ngx_http_close_request(r, 0);
  3265.             return;
  3266.         }

  3268.     } while (rev->ready);

  3270.     if (ngx_handle_read_event(rev, 0) != NGX_OK) {
  3271.         ngx_http_close_request(r, 0);
  3272.         return;
  3273.     }

  3275.     clcf = ngx_http_get_module_loc_conf(r, ngx_http_core_module);

  3277.     timer *= 1000;

  3279.     if (timer > clcf->lingering_timeout) {
  3280.         timer = clcf->lingering_timeout;
  3281.     }

  3283.     ngx_add_timer(rev, timer);
  3284. }


  3287. void
  3288. ‌ngx_http_empty_handler(ngx_event_t *wev)
  3289. {
  3290.     ngx_log_debug0(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, wev->log, 0, "http empty handler");

  3292.     return;
  3293. }


  3296. void
  3297. ‌ngx_http_request_empty_handler(ngx_http_request_t *r)
  3298. {
  3299.     ngx_log_debug0(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, r->connection->log, 0,
  3300.                    "http request empty handler");

  3302.     return;
  3303. }


  3306. ngx_int_t
  3307. ‌ngx_http_send_special(ngx_http_request_t *r, ngx_uint_t flags)
  3308. {
  3309.     ngx_buf_t    *b;
  3310.     ngx_chain_t   out;

  3312.     b = ngx_calloc_buf(r->pool);
  3313.     if (b == NULL) {
  3314.         return NGX_ERROR;
  3315.     }

  3317.     if (flags & NGX_HTTP_LAST) {

  3319.         if (r == r->main && !r->post_action) {
  3320.             b->last_buf = 1;

  3322.         } else {
  3323.             b->sync = 1;
  3324.             b->last_in_chain = 1;
  3325.         }
  3326.     }

  3328.     if (flags & NGX_HTTP_FLUSH) {
  3329.         b->flush = 1;
  3330.     }

  3332.     out.buf = b;
  3333.     out.next = NULL;

  3335.     return ngx_http_output_filter(r, &out);
  3336. }


  3339. static ngx_int_t
  3340. ‌ngx_http_post_action(ngx_http_request_t *r)
  3341. {
  3342.     ngx_http_core_loc_conf_t  *clcf;

  3344.     clcf = ngx_http_get_module_loc_conf(r, ngx_http_core_module);

  3346.     if (clcf->post_action.data == NULL) {
  3347.         return NGX_DECLINED;
  3348.     }

  3350.     if (r->post_action && r->uri_changes == 0) {
  3351.         return NGX_DECLINED;
  3352.     }

  3354.     ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, r->connection->log, 0,
  3355.                    "post action: \"%V\"", &clcf->post_action);

  3357.     r->main->count--;

  3359.     r->http_version = NGX_HTTP_VERSION_9;
  3360.     r->header_only = 1;
  3361.     r->post_action = 1;

  3363.     r->read_event_handler = ngx_http_block_reading;

  3365.     if (clcf->post_action.data[0] == '/') {
  3366.         ngx_http_internal_redirect(r, &clcf->post_action, NULL);

  3368.     } else {
  3369.         ngx_http_named_location(r, &clcf->post_action);
  3370.     }

  3372.     return NGX_OK;
  3373. }


  3376. static void
  3377. ‌ngx_http_close_request(ngx_http_request_t *r, ngx_int_t rc)
  3378. {
  3379.     ngx_connection_t  *c;

  3381.     r = r->main;
  3382.     c = r->connection;

  3384.     ngx_log_debug2(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0,
  3385.                    "http request count:%d blk:%d", r->count, r->blocked);

  3387.     if (r->count == 0) {
  3388.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, c->log, 0, "http request count is zero");
  3389.     }

  3391.     r->count--;

  3393.     if (r->count || r->blocked) {
  3394.         return;
  3395.     }

  3397. #if (NGX_HTTP_SPDY)
  3398.     if (r->spdy_stream) {
  3399.         ngx_http_spdy_close_stream(r->spdy_stream, rc);
  3400.         return;
  3401.     }
  3402. #endif

  3404.     ngx_http_free_request(r, rc);
  3405.     ngx_http_close_connection(c);
  3406. }


  3409. void
  3410. ‌ngx_http_free_request(ngx_http_request_t *r, ngx_int_t rc)
  3411. {
  3412.     ngx_log_t                 *log;
  3413.     ngx_pool_t                *pool;
  3414.     struct linger              linger;
  3415.     ngx_http_cleanup_t        *cln;
  3416.     ngx_http_log_ctx_t        *ctx;
  3417.     ngx_http_core_loc_conf_t  *clcf;

  3419.     log = r->connection->log;

  3421.     ngx_log_debug0(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, log, 0, "http close request");

  3423.     if (r->pool == NULL) {
  3424.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, log, 0, "http request already closed");
  3425.         return;
  3426.     }

  3428.     cln = r->cleanup;
  3429.     r->cleanup = NULL;

  3431.     while (cln) {
  3432.         if (cln->handler) {
  3433.             cln->handler(cln->data);
  3434.         }

  3436.         cln = cln->next;
  3437.     }

  3439. #if (NGX_STAT_STUB)

  3441.     if (r->stat_reading) {
  3442.         (void) ngx_atomic_fetch_add(ngx_stat_reading, -1);
  3443.     }

  3445.     if (r->stat_writing) {
  3446.         (void) ngx_atomic_fetch_add(ngx_stat_writing, -1);
  3447.     }

  3449. #endif

  3451.     if (rc > 0 && (r->headers_out.status == 0 || r->connection->sent == 0)) {
  3452.         r->headers_out.status = rc;
  3453.     }

  3455.     log->action = "logging request";

  3457.     ngx_http_log_request(r);

  3459.     log->action = "closing request";

  3461.     if (r->connection->timedout) {
  3462.         clcf = ngx_http_get_module_loc_conf(r, ngx_http_core_module);

  3464.         if (clcf->reset_timedout_connection) {
  3465.             linger.l_onoff = 1;
  3466.             linger.l_linger = 0;

  3468.             if (setsockopt(r->connection->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER,
  3469.                            (const void *) &linger, sizeof(struct linger)) == -1)
  3470.             {
  3471.                 ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, log, ngx_socket_errno,
  3472.                               "setsockopt(SO_LINGER) failed");
  3473.             }
  3474.         }
  3475.     }

  3477.     /* the various request strings were allocated from r->pool */
  3478.     ctx = log->data;
  3479.     ctx->request = NULL;

  3481.     r->request_line.len = 0;

  3483.     r->connection->destroyed = 1;

  3485.     /*
  3486.      * Setting r->pool to NULL will increase probability to catch double close
  3487.      * of request since the request object is allocated from its own pool.
  3488.      */

  3490.     pool = r->pool;
  3491.     r->pool = NULL;

  3493.     ngx_destroy_pool(pool);
  3494. }


  3497. static void
  3498. ‌ngx_http_log_request(ngx_http_request_t *r)
  3499. {
  3500.     ngx_uint_t                  i, n;
  3501.     ngx_http_handler_pt        *log_handler;
  3502.     ngx_http_core_main_conf_t  *cmcf;

  3504.     cmcf = ngx_http_get_module_main_conf(r, ngx_http_core_module);

  3506.     log_handler = cmcf->phases[NGX_HTTP_LOG_PHASE].handlers.elts;
  3507.     n = cmcf->phases[NGX_HTTP_LOG_PHASE].handlers.nelts;

  3509.     for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
  3510.         log_handler[i](r);
  3511.     }
  3512. }


  3515. void
  3516. ‌ngx_http_close_connection(ngx_connection_t *c)
  3517. {
  3518.     ngx_pool_t  *pool;

  3520.     ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_HTTP, c->log, 0,
  3521.                    "close http connection: %d", c->fd);

  3523. #if (NGX_HTTP_SSL)

  3525.     if (c->ssl) {
  3526.         if (ngx_ssl_shutdown(c) == NGX_AGAIN) {
  3527.             c->ssl->handler = ngx_http_close_connection;
  3528.             return;
  3529.         }
  3530.     }

  3532. #endif

  3534. #if (NGX_STAT_STUB)
  3535.     (void) ngx_atomic_fetch_add(ngx_stat_active, -1);
  3536. #endif

  3538.     c->destroyed = 1;

  3540.     pool = c->pool;

  3542.     ngx_close_connection(c);

  3544.     ngx_destroy_pool(pool);
  3545. }


  3548. static u_char *
  3549. ‌ngx_http_log_error(ngx_log_t *log, u_char *buf, size_t len)
  3550. {
  3551.     u_char              *p;
  3552.     ngx_http_request_t  *r;
  3553.     ngx_http_log_ctx_t  *ctx;

  3555.     if (log->action) {
  3556.         p = ngx_snprintf(buf, len, " while %s", log->action);
  3557.         len -= p - buf;
  3558.         buf = p;
  3559.     }

  3561.     ctx = log->data;

  3563.     p = ngx_snprintf(buf, len, ", client: %V", &ctx->connection->addr_text);
  3564.     len -= p - buf;

  3566.     r = ctx->request;

  3568.     if (r) {
  3569.         return r->log_handler(r, ctx->current_request, p, len);

  3571.     } else {
  3572.         p = ngx_snprintf(p, len, ", server: %V",
  3573.                          &ctx->connection->listening->addr_text);
  3574.     }

  3576.     return p;
  3577. }


  3580. static u_char *
  3581. ‌ngx_http_log_error_handler(ngx_http_request_t *r, ngx_http_request_t *sr,
  3582.     u_char *buf, size_t len)
  3583. {
  3584.     char                      *uri_separator;
  3585.     u_char                    *p;
  3586.     ngx_http_upstream_t       *u;
  3587.     ngx_http_core_srv_conf_t  *cscf;

  3589.     cscf = ngx_http_get_module_srv_conf(r, ngx_http_core_module);

  3591.     p = ngx_snprintf(buf, len, ", server: %V", &cscf->server_name);
  3592.     len -= p - buf;
  3593.     buf = p;

  3595.     if (r->request_line.data == NULL && r->request_start) {
  3596.         for (p = r->request_start; p < r->header_in->last; p++) {
  3597.             if (*p == CR || *p == LF) {
  3598.                 break;
  3599.             }
  3600.         }

  3602.         r->request_line.len = p - r->request_start;
  3603.         r->request_line.data = r->request_start;
  3604.     }

  3606.     if (r->request_line.len) {
  3607.         p = ngx_snprintf(buf, len, ", request: \"%V\"", &r->request_line);
  3608.         len -= p - buf;
  3609.         buf = p;
  3610.     }

  3612.     if (r != sr) {
  3613.         p = ngx_snprintf(buf, len, ", subrequest: \"%V\"", &sr->uri);
  3614.         len -= p - buf;
  3615.         buf = p;
  3616.     }

  3618.     u = sr->upstream;

  3620.     if (u && u->peer.name) {

  3622.         uri_separator = "";

  3624. #if (NGX_HAVE_UNIX_DOMAIN)
  3625.         if (u->peer.sockaddr && u->peer.sockaddr->sa_family == AF_UNIX) {
  3626.             uri_separator = ":";
  3627.         }
  3628. #endif

  3630.         p = ngx_snprintf(buf, len, ", upstream: \"%V%V%s%V\"",
  3631.                          &u->schema, u->peer.name,
  3632.                          uri_separator, &u->uri);
  3633.         len -= p - buf;
  3634.         buf = p;
  3635.     }

  3637.     if (r->headers_in.host) {
  3638.         p = ngx_snprintf(buf, len, ", host: \"%V\"",
  3639.                          &r->headers_in.host->value);
  3640.         len -= p - buf;
  3641.         buf = p;
  3642.     }

  3644.     if (r->headers_in.referer) {
  3645.         p = ngx_snprintf(buf, len, ", referrer: \"%V\"",
  3646.                          &r->headers_in.referer->value);
  3647.         buf = p;
  3648.     }

  3650.     return buf;
  3651. }
